definition: to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
whole/in one lump
complete
to swallow/to take
jujube/dates

sentences.english: You can't swallow the idea in that book overnight.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一个晚上囫囵吞枣式地读完那本书。

sentences.english: Do not read without understanding. One should get what he need.
sentences.chinese: 读书不能囫囵吞枣，而要从中吸取自己需要的东西。

sentences.english: Do you scoff down a huge lunch before feeling lethargic all afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 囫囵吞枣的吃完午饭，然后又整个下午昏昏沉沉？

sentences.english: Trying to digest new information in one lump is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 想囫囵吞枣消化吸收新信息是困难的。

sentences.english: Some students gobble up information as fast as they receive it.
sentences.chinese: 有些学生一接触信息就囫囵吞枣地马上吸收。

definition: lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
extensive reading
to read cursorily/to skim through
tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid
a wooden word-by-word reading
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing/fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
insipid
ten lines at a glance (idiom)/to read very rapidly
force feeding (as a teaching method)
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: intensive reading/to peruse/perusal
